wikipedia_page.main: Toby Marlow (born 12 October 1994) is an English writer, composer and actor most known for his work as composer and co-writer of the West End musical Six.

response: Catherine Parr is a character in the 2017 musical Six, by Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss. In the West End production, the role of Catherine Parr has been played by Izuka Hoyle, Maiya Quansah-Breed, and Danielle Steers. A United States run in Chicago in May 2019 saw Catherine played by Anna Uzele. Six was set to open on Broadway in April 2020, with Catherine to be played again by Uzele, but was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. It is set to re-open in October 2021.
***Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss' musical Six (originally performed in 2017) debuts in the West End
*Toby Marlow, co-writer of the West End musical Six, about Henry VIII's wives.

* Six (29 September 2021 - booking until May 2022) music and lyrics by Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss

Six is a pop-rock musical featuring each of Henry's wives. A major theme of the show is that women should be the ones to tell their stories and how much more there is to their stories than how their relationships with Henry ended. The musical was written by Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss. It originated in Edinburgh in 2017, moving to the West End in January 2019. In May 2019, Six had its North American premier at the Chicago Shakespeare Theater. and moved to Broadway in March 2020. The tag line of the show, "Divorced. Beheaded. LIVE in concert!", alludes to the rhyme describing the queens' fates.
* Toby Marlow (born 1994), writer and composer

In December 2020, McHale was a part of a mini musical music video called "Stay Inside". He co-starred alongside dancer Haley Fitzgerald. The song and video were written by the composers of the Broadway and West End musical SIX, Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss. The video was choreographed by Kyle Hanagami. Viewers were encouraged to make donations to Broadway Cares/Equity Fights AIDS, the philanthropic heart of Broadway.

response: | Joe Beighton, Tom Curran, Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss

Six is a British musical comedy with book, music, and lyrics by Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss. The musical is a modern retelling of the lives of the six wives of Henry VIII presented as a pop concert, as the wives take turns singing and telling their story to see who suffered the most due to Henry and should, therefore, become the group's lead singer.

Toby Marlow was selected in late 2016 by Cambridge University Musical Theatre Society to write a new musical to be performed at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe the next summer. The idea for what became Six came to Marlow while studying in his final year at Cambridge University. The initial six wives' concert concept occurred to him in a poetry class, and Marlow decided to get his friend Lucy Moss involved. Despite uncertainties, the pair wrote part of the show while studying for their final exams. Marlow researched by reading Antonia Fraser's The Six Wives of Henry VIII, while Moss viewed a documentary series, Six Wives by Lucy Worsley. At their first writing session together, they watched a 2011 Beyoncé concert and story-telling performance,  Live at Roseland: Elements of 4. Over the course of approximately 10 nonconsecutive days, Marlow and Moss established the foundation for the show.
Show co-creator Toby Marlow filled in as Catherine Parr for two West End performances on 28 July 2019 due to a cast-wide illness.
|Joe Beighton, Tom Curran, Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss
